top_categories.workout_context: 225 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Trans-Sylvania Epic's PA mountains, Multi-stage forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 225 miles.
At Trans-Sylvania Epic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
67ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Trans-Sylvania Epic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
225 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
15,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 225 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 15,000ft of climbing on pA mountain gravel does to your power file on race day.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Trans-Sylvania Epic. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Trans-Sylvania Epic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
15,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 225 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 225 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Trans-Sylvania Epic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on pa mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: pa mountains, multi-stage, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 225 miles of pa mountain gravel in Pennsylvania.
